  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Runs implement or jarImplement depending on the number of arguments.

      If the args[0] is --jar, then implementJar will be run with the args[1] and args[2], otherwise - implement with the args[0] and args[1]

      Parameters:
      args - Arguments to implement and implement Jar, first the --jar flag (if exist), then the name of the inherited class, last the location.
      See Also:
      • implement(Class, Path)
      • implementJar(Class, Path)

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • writeClassImplementation

      private void writeClassImplementation(Class<?> token, Path path) throws ImplerException
      Create a successor of the token class according to the rules described in implement.
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      path - way to create implementation.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - on class write error
      See Also:
      • implement(Class, Path)

    • checkClass

      private void checkClass(Class<?> token) throws ImplerException
      Checks if a class can be inherited, throws an error otherwise
      Parameters:
      token - class to be tested
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if it is impossible to create an heir

    • addExtendedMethod

      private void addExtendedMethod(Method[] methods, Set<TrueMethod> ansMethods)
      Selects from the passed methods only those that can be implemented in the extended class
      Parameters:
      methods - a set of methods from which suitable ones will be selected
      ansMethods - the set into which suitable methods will be added
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if method in methods is null

    • getExceptionsStroke

      private String getExceptionsStroke(Constructor<?> con)
      Returns all constructor exceptions as a string in java code style.
      Parameters:
      con - constructor to get exceptions from
      Returns:
      java style string with all exceptions in this constructor

    • getParametersStroke

      private String getParametersStroke(Executable el, boolean withType)
      Returns all Executable element parameters as a string in java code style.
      Parameters:
      el - Executable element to get Parameter from
      withType - True if it is necessary to infer the types of the parameters and false otherwise
      Returns:
      java style string with all Parameters in this Executable element
      Throws:
      MalformedParametersException - вЂ“ if the class file contains a MethodParameters attribute that is improperly formatted.
      See Also:
      • Executable
      • Parameter

    • getModifiersStroke

      private String getModifiersStroke(int modifiersCode)
      Returns all modifiers as a string in java code style.
      Parameters:
      modifiersCode - code describing available modifiers
      Returns:
      java style string with all modifiers in this modifiersCode

    • implementMethods

      private void implementMethods(BufferedWriter writer, Method m) throws IOException
      Returns method element parameters as a string in java code style and write in transferred writer
      Parameters:
      writer - the writer in which the method will be written
      m - writable method
      Throws:
      IOException - when a writer error occurs
      MalformedParametersException - вЂ“ вЂ“ if the class m file contains a MethodParameters attribute that is improperly formatted.

    • getReturnTypeStroke

      private String getReturnTypeStroke(Class<?> m)
      Returns returnType as a string in java code style for return in method.
      Parameters:
      m - return type, may be primitive
      Returns:
      Returns a string like "return default-value". For void, it returns an empty string.

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      jarFile - target .jar file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when an implementation cannot be generated or a compile/archive error has occurred

    • compileJava

      private void compileJava(Class<?> token, Path path, String classPath) throws ImplerException
      Compiles the specified class at the given path and with the given classpath
      Parameters:
      token - class to be compiled
      path - directory for compilation
      classPath - classpath used as an argument during compilation
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if compilation fails or compiler don't exist
      InvalidPathException - if the path to the token does not exist

    • createJar

      private void createJar(Class<?> token, Path jarPath, Path classDir) throws ImplerException
      Creates a .jar file from the classes in the directory temp along the path jarFile with the passed classPath as MANIFEST.MF.
      Parameters:
      token - the class from which the compiled files were received
      jarPath - the path along which the future jarFile should be located
      classDir - the directory where the compiled classes are located
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if an error occurs while opening or writing to an output stream

    • getNameWithPackage

      private String getNameWithPackage(Class<?> token, String separator)
      Returns the name with package to the new implementation along with the package.
      Parameters:
      token - the class whose full name of the successor we are looking for
      separator - separator to be used in the name with package
      Returns:
      a string consisting of the package with the selected delimiters and the class name
